# Research Project

:::{.center-p}
## A Specification Curve Analysis of NLP Classifiers Diagnosing Psychological Mechanisms Influencing Decision-Making {.center}

<small>Master's Thesis Sabou Rani Stocker</small>
<br>
<small>Cognitive and Behavioral Decision Research</small>
<br>
<small>University of Zurich</small>
<br>
<small>supervised by Prof. Dr. Renato Frey and Olivia Fischer</small>
:::

## Background

:::{.incremental}
* <span class="highlight-p">many proposed</span> state-dependent influences, <br> <span class="highlight-p">little research</span> on their occurence in real life

  :::{.source-p}
  @lobTaxonomyStateSpecificPsychological2025, @hollemanRealWorldApproachIts2020, @quinanEcologicalValidityEvaluating2015
  :::

* <span class="highlight-p">natural language as data</span> and NLP as method

  :::{.source-p}
  @binzHowShouldAdvancement2025, @ostrovskyVerbalReportsData2024,
  :::

* promising first results but <span class="highlight-p">no systematic evaluation</span>

  :::{.source-p}
  @heitzLinguisticFeaturesExtracted2024, @fischerReuseNeedlePay2024, @bhatiaExploringVariabilityRisk2024, and others
  :::
:::

## Aim & Research Question

### Aim
Systematic comparison of algorithms harnessing NLP on their <span class="highlight-p">capabilities and limitations in diagnosing state-specific mechanisms</span> influencing people when making decisions
<br>
<br>

### Research Question
How reliably can we <span class="highlight-p">identify state-specific mechanisms from natural language</span> influencing people in decision-making?

## Implications {.smaller}

### Methodological
* given the right circumstances, <span class="highlight-p">psychological mechanisms can be inferred</span> from natural language
* methodological approach <span class="highlight-p">$\geq$</span> mechanism

### Practical
* scaleable analysis of text-data
* viable to test (co-)occurrence of mechanisms in naturalistic scenarios
* validation with real world data & co-occurring mechanisms pending

## The Privacy-Convenience-Paradox

:::{.definition-p}
*privacy calculus*: theory on mental cost-benefit-analysis for sharing private information 
:::

:::{.source-p}
@dinevExtendedPrivacyCalculus2006, @bekeConsumersPrivacyCalculus2022
:::

:::{.definition-p}
*privacy-convenience-paradox*: preference and actual behavior are different from each other
:::

:::{.source-p}
@ackermanPrivacyEcommerceExamining1999, @zhangPrivacyVsConvenience2024
:::

## Research Question

:::{.v-center-container}
(How) can we <span class="highlight-p">explain discrepancies between preference and behavior</span> in online disclosure of private data through theories of <span class="highlight-p">bounded rationality</span> and heuristics targeting the fast systems of <span class="highlight-p">dual-process systems</span>?
:::

$$

## Alternative Formulas of the PC-Paradox {#formal-model}

$$
{\text{ABH} \overset{?}{=}}
\left\{
\begin{aligned}
&\frac{1}{1+e^{-k(\text{WTS})}} \\[0.6em]
&\frac{1}{1+e^{-k(\text{WTS}+\color{red}{\alpha \cdot \text{IC}}+\color{blue}{\beta \cdot \text{EW}})}} \\[0.6em]
&\frac{1}{1+e^{-k(\text{WTS}+\color{red}{\alpha \cdot \text{IC}}+\color{blue}{\beta \cdot \text{EW}} + \color{green}{\gamma\cdot \text{IC}\cdot \text{EW}})}}
\end{aligned}
\right.
$$
